meanings.definition: To leave or give by will after one's death.
meanings.sent1: Grandma bequeaths her antique jewelry to me in her will.
meanings.sent2: He bequeaths his entire estate to charity upon his passing.
meanings.sent3: The old man jokingly bequeaths his collection of socks to his cat in his will.
meanings.sent4: She bequeaths her wisdom to the next generation like a precious heirloom.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree bequeaths its shade to weary travelers on hot days.

meanings.sent1: The tradition of storytelling bequeaths knowledge from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent2: He bequeaths his love for music to his children through piano lessons.
meanings.sent3: The chef bequeaths his secret recipe for the best spaghetti to his apprentice.
meanings.sent4: The river bequeaths its fertile soil to the fields along its banks.
meanings.sent5: The artist bequeaths her creativity to inspire others to create beauty.
